Arcane Cascade+.name: Arcane Cascade+
Arcane Cascade+.description:
After you wield magic, you can enter a special stance to make your attacks more effective.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-actions.Item.pso7iTJgU852oLfO]{Arcane Cascade+}

Arcane Conservation.name: Arcane Conservation
Arcane Conservation.description: A magus is known not only for their ability to channel magic into their esoteric blows, but also in capturing the residual energy from these attacks for future use. The most common type of these methods being Arcane Cascade, absorbing the energy of recently channeled magic into their attacks. This is but one way that a magus can conserve residual magic for future use, and other such methods rely on archaic, costly, and sometimes even accursed knowledge.

Bargained Essence.name: Bargained Essence
Bargained Essence.description: With strained breath, you call upon the physicality you bargained for with your broker entity to aid you alongside the spells you have gained from them. At 1st level, you choose the essence of yourself that you chose to bolster in a bargain, and the essence you sought to trade, applying both effects to yourself. You must choose two different essences when choosing what to bolster or trade. Your bolstered essence also grants you additional effects while in the Havok Cascade stance, a special version of Arcane Cascade stance, and your traded essence applies a penalty when you use an action with the havok trait.

Body Essence - Bolster.name: Body Essence - Bolster
Body Essence - Bolster.description:
Bolster Your attained essence has manifested a foreign graft onto your body, the nature of your bargain on display for all to see. You gain darkvision or scent (imprecise) 30 feet and an unarmed attack of your choice on the table below. Once these choices are made they cannot be changed without renegotiating the bargain with your original broker (subject to GM discretion). You become trained in Athletics or Survival.

Bolstered Havok While under the effects of a Havok Cascade, the unarmed attack you gained increases its die size by one step and gains the havok critical effect when you critically succeed at a Strike with your unarmed attack.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
You gain an unarmed 1d6 slashing claw attack, with the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits.

Its havok critical effect is:

The target is off-guard until the start of your next turn.

Diametric Fusion.name: Diametric Fusion
Diametric Fusion.description:
You have learned to bind magic between two weapons, creating a dyad of arcane energy that unifies them into a magical union. This union forges a bond between your weapons, as you have done so with might and magic.

During your daily preparations, choose two one-handed melee weapons in which you are trained to be your diametric weapons. When you are wielding these weapons, they gain the twin trait and are treated as the same weapon type for the purposes of the twin trait. If the two weapons you chose already had the twin trait and were the same weapon type, increase the damage from the twin trait by 1 per weapon damage die.

While you are in @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-class-features.Item.SkUkDSnIU1LHBSHf]{Arcane Cascade+}, weapons you wield with the twin trait increase their damage against enemies you previously attacked this turn by 1, by 2 if you have weapon specialization, or by 3 if you have greater weapon specialization. The damage from your twin trait is of the same type as your Arcane Cascade while you are in Arcane Cascade. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-actions.Item.WI9T2TqYWk5M5Ed9]{Residual Spellstrike} reaction.

Conflux Spell @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.1nrYVqps9R4q3CIM]{Dual-Pattern Strike}

Studious Spells 7th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7dKtMehJ6YrXwJLR]{Magnetic Attraction}; 11th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1bXLp8cyIKFjZtVx]{Temporal Twin}; 13th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A7w3YQBrFNH8KYsB]{Mirror's Misfortune}

Foundry Note When doing your daily preparations, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.LnasyNmfSsrgJsHj]{Effect: Diametric Weapon} effect to mark your chosen weapons as your diametric weapons.

Essence Mystic.name: Essence Mystic
Essence Mystic.description: Some spellswords gain Essence their magic through Mystic years of careful Archetype study and dedication to the blade. Others, however, prefer a more immediate path to power. Essence Mystics seek out a broker who possesses great arcane power with which they make a trade; their heart to a dragon, their calm to an elemental, their hand to a lich, or something similar. In this exchange, the mystic inherits the magic or strength that allows them to bolster one of their essences. These bargains and brokers give the magus their power, but it is by their ambition and discipline they achieve their true power.

Essence Mystic Spellcasting.name: Essence Mystic Spellcasting
Essence Mystic Spellcasting.description:
Essence Mystic Spellcasting

Your body is forever linked to an incredibly powerful spellcaster. You can cast spells using the Cast a Spell activity, and you can supply material, somatic, and verbal when casting spells. Because of the magic you draw from your monstrous body part, you can usually replace material components with somatic components, so you don't need a material component pouch.

Each day, you can cast one 1st-level spell and five cantrips. You must know spells to cast them, and you learn them via the spell repertoire class feature. The number of spells you can cast each day is called your spell slots.

As you increase in level as an essence mystic, the power of your master inside you grows and grants you additional, more powerful spell slots as normal for a magus of your level.

Some of your spells require you to attempt a spell attack roll to see how effective they are, or have your enemies roll against your spell DC (typically by attempting a saving throw). Since your spellcasting ability is Charisma, your spell attack rolls and spell DCs use your Charisma modifier. Details on calculating these statistics appear in Spell Attack Roll.

Heightening Spells

When you get spell slots of 2nd level and higher, you can fill those slots with stronger versions of lower-level spells. This increases the spell's level to match the spell slot.This increases the spell's level, heightening it to match the spell slot. Many spells have specific improvements when they are heightened to certain levels.

Cantrips

A cantrip is a special type of spell that doesn't use spell slots. You can cast a cantrip at will, any number of times per day. A cantrip is always automatically heightened to half your level rounded up â€” this is usually equal to the highest level of spell you can cast as an essence mystic magus. For example, as a 1st-level essence mystic, your cantrips are 1st-level spells, and as a 5th-level essence mystic, your cantrips are 3rd-level spells.

Essence Tactics.name: Essence Tactics
Essence Tactics.description: You have learned to merge aspects of your battle prowess with a specific type of battle tactics, much the same that other magus gain a hybrid study. Choose a hybrid study. You gain the initial benefits of that hybrid study, and add the associated studious spells to your havok spells. You do not gain the initial conflux spell of the chosen hybrid study. For the purposes of feats that would require you to be of a certain hybrid study, you count as having the hybrid study you chose.

Fangs.name: Fangs
Fangs.description:
You gain an unarmed 1d8 piercing fangs attack, with the grapple and unarmed traits.

Its havok critical effect is:

The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage plus 1 damage per weapon damage dice.

Flinging Figments.name: Flinging Figments
Flinging Figments.description:
You have cultivated a connection to kinetic energy. You swing your arms in constant motion allowing you to harness the energy into weapons from your mind's eye to create copies of your weapon.

During your daily preparations, choose a single weapon in your possession with which you are trained that has the thrown trait as your bonded weapon. You can @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-macros.Macro.W8UN3jT7H4OQKXEl]{Conjure a Figment} of the bonded weapon as part of making a ranged Strike and these figments last until the Strike is completed. When you use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.KVj5ofUwu3VJSrVw]{Spellstrike}, you can make ranged Strikes with your figments, as long as the target is within the first range increment. You can deliver the spell even if its range is shorter than the range increment of your ranged attack. The figment weapon gains all of the fundamental and property runes of your bonded weapon when you use it to make ranged Strikes. You must have a hand free or be wielding your bonded weapon to make Strikes with your figments.

When you're in @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-class-features.Item.SkUkDSnIU1LHBSHf]{Arcane Cascade+} stance, thrown Strikes with your bonded weapon and its figments increase their range by 5 feet, or by 10 feet if you have weapon specialization, or 15 feet if you have greater weapon specialization.

Conflux Spell @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.y9uj8UHvnUWdwpc0]{Rebounding Figment Strike}

Studious Spells 7th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3JG1t3T4mWn6vTke]{Blur}; 11th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fPlFRu4dp09qJs3K]{Mind of Menace}; 13th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TUj8eugNqAvB1vVR]{Creation}

Havok Cascade.name: Havok Cascade
Havok Cascade.description:
With strained breath, you call upon the physicality of your master to aid you alongside the spells you have gained from them.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-actions.Item.udYhojO4FsgzGFsl]{Havok Cascade}

Heart Essence - Trade.name: Heart Essence - Trade
Heart Essence - Trade.description:
Trade You succumb to your emotions more easily and your havok floods you with emotion that makes you sway. You take a â€“2 penalty to Will saves against emotion effects and gain a weakness to bleed damage equal to half your level (minimum 1).

Traded Havok After you use an action with the havok trait, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} or increase your clumsy value by 1 if you were already clumsy for 1 minute or until you make a successful Strike.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.IWQ3PK1Tg3sZm75N]{Effect: Heart Essence - Traded Havok}

Horizon Spellshell.name: Horizon Spellshell
Horizon Spellshell.description:
You have mastered the art of merging artillery and magic, giving you the ability to infuse your ammunition. When you fire your magically infused ammunition, radiant energy might surge around the shot, strange symbols may emerge in tandem, or even remnants of the infused spell may be produced on contact.

When you use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.KVj5ofUwu3VJSrVw]{Spellstrike}, you can make a ranged weapon Strike with a crossbow, firearm, or sling, as long as the target is within the first range increment. You can deliver the spell even if its range is shorter than the range increment of your ranged attack.

During your daily preparations, when you would prepare a spell in one of your spell slots, you can instead choose to @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-macros.Macro.Sny8XczR6ZDB2XRZ]{Prepare a Spellshell}. A spellshell is a special type of spell that can only be used to Cast a Spell as part of a ranged Spellstrike with a crossbow, firearm, or sling. When you Spellstrike with a spellshell, the weapon can be fired even if it was not loaded, as the ammunition is provided as part of the Cast a Spell activity and your ammunition gains the arcane trait, making them magical.

When you are in Arcane Cascade, crossbows, firearms, and slings gain the scatter 5ft. trait. If the weapon already has the scatter trait, instead increase the range of the radius by 5 feet. Determine the damage type from the scatter trait as described in Arcane Cascade.

Conflux Spell @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.Ccpfa7hukxOIhqYl]{Quantum Shot}

Studious Spells 7th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CQWTyDxiVSW4uRn7]{Empty Pack}; 11th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Pwq6T7xpfAJXV5aj]{Phantom Prison}; 13th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zvKWclOZ7A53DObE]{Clairvoyance}

Horn.name: Horn
Horn.description:
You gain an unarmed 1d8 piercing horn attack, with the shove and unarmed traits.

Its havok critical effect is:

The target is knocked away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Jaunty Visage.name: Jaunty Visage
Jaunty Visage.description:
Your magic is re-purposed so that it generates an eldritch mask, arcane tattoos, conjured clothing, or some other cosmetic appearance unique to you. These manifestations carry with them emotions of controlled power, allowing you to exert magical energy to inspire emotions in your enemies through appearance alone.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-actions.Item.f35tGJddqBhbxr1J]{Don Visage} action. You are considered to be in Arcane Cascade as long as you have your visage donned. You treat the additional damage dealt to creatures affected by these actions as the damage value of Arcane Cascade for the purposes of feats and abilities dependent on Arcane Cascades damage bonus. Hybrid studies or feats that increase the damage bonus of the Arcane Cascade stance (such as laughing shadow), instead increase the damage bonus to targets under these effects by the same amount.

If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.nlXyh7828TgZIewv]{Capture Magic}, you can immediately Don Visage and use the associated action against the foe who targeted you when you used your reaction. If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.mB7ENhF10qoOwQyG]{Resounding Cascade}, allies within the emanation also gain your damage bonus against enemies under the effects of your Don Visage skill action.

Jaws.name: Jaws
Jaws.description:
You gain an unarmed 1d8 piercing jaws attack, with the trip and unarmed traits.

Its havok critical effect is:

The target is grabbed by your jaws until the beginning of your next turn.

Mind Essence - Bolster.name: Mind Essence - Bolster
Mind Essence - Bolster.description:
Bolster Your bolstered essence has blessed you with knowledge unlike any other. You become trained in Forbidden Lore, a special lore skill that can be used to Recall Knowledge regarding arcane spells, artifacts, and creatures of any type, but that can't be used to Recall Knowledge on other topics. At 7th level, your proficiency in Forbidden Lore increases to expert, and at 15th level your proficiency in Forbidden Lore increases to master. You become trained in one skill with the Recall Knowledge action.

Bolstered Havok While under the effects of a Havok Cascade, you can use Charisma as your modifier on your Forbidden Lore checks instead of your Intelligence modifier and if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. You can attempt Recall Knowledge checks with Forbidden Lore on creatures multiple times while in Arcane Cascade. When you succeed at a Recall Knowledge against a creature with your Forbidden Lore, they gain a weakness equal to half your level to damage of the same type as your Arcane Cascade for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.T4oyAD56S3b2ambF]{Effect: Mind Essence Bolstered Havok Weakness}

Mind Essence - Trade.name: Mind Essence - Trade
Mind Essence - Trade.description:
Trade Your mind is easily targeted by mental attacks and your havok makes you overwhelmed. You take a â€“1 penalty to Will saves against mental effects and gain a weakness to mental damage equal to half your level (minimum 1).

Traded Havok After you use an action with the Havok trait, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} or increase your stupefied value by 1 if you were already stupefied for 1 minute or until you make a successful Strike.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.65x4OuvCBzqnP044]{Effect: Mind Essence - Traded Havok}

Scourging Lash.name: Scourging Lash
Scourging Lash.description:
With a loud crack, you flourish your weapon of choice, keeping opponents at arm's length and lacing it through with magic. Your magic is blisteringly fast as it channels through you and into your weapon, be it a whip, rope, net, chain or a lash.

You can wield @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-miscellaneous.Item.oLW3HqWYkTv45ERo]{ropes} as one-handed martial weapons, and they deal 1d4 slashing damage and have the finesse, grapple, nonlethal, reach, and two-hand d8 traits and are in the flail group. You can apply runes ropes as if they were weapons. You do not take a circumstance penalty to your attack roll for making a lethal attack with a rope.

When you enter @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-class-features.Item.SkUkDSnIU1LHBSHf]{Arcane Cascade+}, your attacks leave stinging echoes of your lashing attacks. When you successfully Strike or Grapple a target with a flail, you deal 1 additional persistent damage, or 2 if you have weapon specialization, or 3 if you have greater weapon specialization. This persistent damage is of the same type as your Arcane Cascade.

Conflux Spell @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.HqFY1ahHH4P3QaHn]{Coiling Grasp}

Studious Spells 7th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EDwakYQTS1t6XHD4]{Umbral Extraction}; 11th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.AMEu5zzLN7uCX645]{Ghostly Weapon}; 13th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GzdgM0m7wXKuFSho]{Rope Trick}

Soul Essence - Bolster.name: Soul Essence - Bolster
Soul Essence - Bolster.description:
Bolster You are vibrant and full of life, the bolstered essence of your bargain. You gain either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.AmP0qu7c5dlBSath]{Toughness} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.I0BhPWqYf1bbzEYg]{Diehard} as a bonus feat and a +2 status bonus against death effects. You treat the DC to recover from the dying condition as 2 lower than your normal amount. You become trained in Medicine or Religion.

Bolstered Havok While under the effects of a Havok Cascade, you gain a resistance to physical damage equal to the damage bonus of your Arcane Cascade and if you would regain Hit Points from a healing effect, you regain additional Hit Points equal to half your level the first time you receive healing from that effect.

Sparkling Targe+.name: Sparkling Targe+
Sparkling Targe+.description:
You've studied the applications of magic, training yourself to perform not just offensive maneuvers but defensive tactics as well. When magic flows through you, your shield can block impossible things, even a dragon's breath or a magic missile.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8] general feat.

When you're in Arcane Cascade stance with your shield raised, your circumstance bonus to AC from your shield also applies to your saves against spells and other magical effects. In addition, damage you take as a result of a spell or magical effect while you're in Arcane Cascade can trigger your Shield Block reaction, even if the damage isn't physical. When blocking damage in this way, increase your shield's Hardness by an amount equal to the extra damage from Arcane Cascade (typically 1, but 2 if you have weapon specialization, or 3 if you have greater weapon specialization). These benefits apply whether you're using an actual shield, the shield spell, or something else that works like a shield (such as a raised tome if you have the Raise a Tome feat).

Conflux Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.53NqGTJOf4LcjVyD]

Spell ignition.name: Spell ignition
Spell ignition.description:
Rather than absorb and re-use the ambient magic left behind by the casting of spells, youâ€™ve mastered the art of swirling it into a magic haze of pain. Spells you cast leave behind magic that crackles and burns, making it dangerous to remain in its presence.

You are considered to be in Arcane Cascade as long as an area of ambient magic is present for the purposes of feats or abilities that require it. You are immune to the damage dealt by your own ambient magic. For determining values that would be dependent on the Arcane Cascade stanceâ€™s damage bonus, you instead use the number of rounds your Spell Ignition lasts. Hybrid studies or feats that increase the damage bonus of the Arcane Cascade stance instead grant you a damage bonus equal to the increased amount that lasts for the same duration and follows the same rules for damage types as the Arcane Cascade stance.

If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.nlXyh7828TgZIewv]{Capture Magic}, you can create ambient magic in the space of the foe who targeted you when you used your reaction, so long as the foe is within 30 feet of you. If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.mB7ENhF10qoOwQyG]{Resounding Cascade}, allies within the emanation are immune to the damage of your ambient magic.

Spell Repertoire (Essence Mystic).name: Spell Repertoire (Essence Mystic)
Spell Repertoire (Essence Mystic).description:
The collection of spells you can cast is called your spell repertoire. At 1st level, you learn two arcane 1st-level spells of your choice and five arcane cantrips of your choice. You can cast any spell in your spell repertoire by using a spell slot of an appropriate spell level. Your spell slots and the spells in your spell repertoire are separate. If a feat or other ability adds a spell to your spell repertoire, it doesn't give you another spell slot, and vice versa.

You add to this spell repertoire as you increase in level. Each time you get a spell slot (see Table 2-2: Essence Mystic Spells per Day), you add a spell of the same level to your spell repertoire. At 2nd level, you select another 1st-level spell. At 3rd level, you add the first 2nd-level spell to your repertoire. At 4th level you gain your second and your spell repertoire reaches its maximum size of five spells.

At 5th level, in addition to adding two 3rd-level spells to your repertoire, you lose your lowest level of spell slots. Any time you lose a level of spell slots, you lose two spells in your repertoire as well. These can come from spells you already know or out of the number of new spells you're learning. On levels in which you don't change your spell slots, you can swap out multiple spells, as described below.

Swapping Spells in Your Repertoire

As you gain new spells in your repertoire, you might want to replace some of the spells you previously learned.

Each time you gain a level and learn new spells, you can swap out one of your old spells for a different spell of the same level. If it's a level at which you lose a set of lower-level slots, you can replace the two in either order. You can also instead swap a cantrip. You can also swap out spells by retraining during downtime.

At 6th level and every even level thereafter, you can swap out any number of your spells for different spells of a level you can cast. When you do, you must keep at least one spell you can cast with your lowest level of spell slots so you don't end up with slots you can't use. For instance, at 6th level you would need to keep at least one 2nd-level spell, but all your other spells could be 3rd level.

Starlit Span+.name: Starlit Span+
Starlit Span+.description:
With magic, the sky's the limit, and you can't be bound by the confines of physical proximity. Your power reaches as far as your senses can perceive, transcending the space between you and your target even with spells that normally require direct physical contact.

When you use Spellstrike, you can make a ranged weapon or ranged unarmed Strike, as long as the target is within the first range increment of your ranged weapon or ranged unarmed attack. You can deliver the spell even if its range is shorter than the range increment of your ranged attack.

While you are in Arcane Cascade, when you make a ranged Strike, you and targets you successfully hit exude bright light in a 5-foot radius (and dim light for the next 5 feet) for 1 round. The radius of the bright and dim light increases by 10 feet if you have weapon specialization, or 15 feet if you have greater weapon specialization. Your Strikes gain the light trait and the level of this effect is equal to your level.

Conflux Spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.nVfP43Xbs6I1PO8v]

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description:
You gain an unarmed 1d8 bludgeoning tail attack, with the reach and unarmed traits.

Its havok critical effect is:

The target is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This is forced movement.

Wrought Warplating.name: Wrought Warplating
Wrought Warplating.description:
Your magic is channeled not through a weapon, but through the armor you wear over your body. You cover every inch of your skin in thick iron which you carve full of runes and magic sigils that render you all but invincible in combat.

You are trained in heavy armor. At 11th level, if you gain the medium armor expertise class feature, you also gain expert proficiency in heavy armor, and if you gain the medium armor mastery class feature, you also gain master proficiency in heavy armor. When you become expert in these armors, you gain the armor specialization effects of medium and heavy armor.

While in @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-class-features.Item.SkUkDSnIU1LHBSHf]{Arcane Cascade+} and wearing medium or heavy armor, you gain resistance equal to Arcane Cascadeâ€™s damage bonus to the same damage type as your Arcane Cascade.

Conflux Spell @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.XcXr57piLzPRCemI]{Metamorphic Armor}

Studious Spells 7th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uiv8FKuxE8HOWTxW]{Instant Armor}; 11th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CIjj9CU5ekeq1oLT]{Warding Aggression}; 13th: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NBSBFHxBm88qxQUy]{Chromatic Armor}

Bladebound.name: Bladebound
Bladebound.description:
While most magus learned to conserve magic within their Strikes, you were gifted, or perhaps plagued, with being in the service of a devourer of residual magic. Despite the prevailing name, a black blade can be a weapon of any form, though it is common for them to be edge weapons, as the ability to draw blood from an edge serves their needs quickly. The burden of a black blade often hangs heavy on those that wield them, and though you provide each other power, its price is the most costly of all things: Life.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.bcxIg7wi8ZAhvhOD]{Familiar} magus feat and a black blade specific familiar. Unlike other familiars, you can never get rid of your black blade for another familiar, and if you would ever be parted from your black blade or it were ever destroyed, it returns to you magically during your next daily preparations.

If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.nlXyh7828TgZIewv]{Capture Magic}, your black blade uses its reaction to Invigorate with the same trigger when you would normally use your reaction to Capture Magic and you gain the same bonus to damage if your blade was already invigorated. If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.mB7ENhF10qoOwQyG]{Resounding Cascade}, allies within the emanation gain the effects of your black bladeâ€™s Invigorate with the same circumstances as if you had used the Arcane Cascade stance.

Foundry Note You can use the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-macros.Macro.6ohib5vMbHDvQH4D]{Black Blade: Change Form} macro to change the form of your black blade during your dailiy preparations.

Body Essence - Trade.name: Body Essence - Trade
Body Essence - Trade.description:
Trade Your body is more susceptible to afflictions and your havok makes you less responsive. You take a â€“2 penalty to Fortitude saves against afflictions and gain a weakness to poison damage equal to half your level (minimum 1).

Traded Havok After you use an action with the Havok trait, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 minute or until you make a successful Strike.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.oQhoRFwWbZjJflpo]{Effect: Body Essence - Traded Havok}

Havok Spells.name: Havok Spells
Havok Spells.description:
Your bargained essences grants you additional spells that can enhance your power in combat. You gain two special 2nd-level havok spell slots, which can be used to prepare @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5KobTMrZeZxuXMgl]{Spider Climb}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{True Strike}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MZGkMsPBztFN0pUO]{Water Breathing}, and an additional spell depending on your essence tactics.

During your daily preparations, you can choose two spells from this list to be added to your spell repertoire, and casting spells from a havok spell slot gives the spell the havok trait. At 11th level, the extra slots increase to 3rd level and you add @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste} and an additional spell depending on your essence tactics. At 13th level, the extra slots increase to 4th level and you add @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly} and an additional spell depending on your essence tactics.

Heart Essence - Bolster.name: Heart Essence - Bolster
Heart Essence - Bolster.description:
Bolster You traded for a release of emotion and to satisfy your innermost desires. You are trained in your choice of Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Performance and gain a level 1 skill feat associated with your selection. You become trained in Performance or Intimidation.

Bolstered Havok While under the effects of a Havok Cascade, you are immune to fear effects and you gain a +1 status bonus to the skill you chose for your bolstered essence. This status bonus increases to +2 if you have weapon specialization, or to +3 if you have greater weapon specialization.

Marionette Mastery.name: Marionette Mastery
Marionette Mastery.description:
You have learned to leave threads of magic with your strikes and spells, allowing you to control your enemies with enchanting magic or more easily fool them with illusions. The threads of magic are a tapestry which you weave as easily as a seamstress pulls thread.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-actions.Item.BHRX5O7n4YONxvDY]{Puppet String} action. You are considered to be in Arcane Cascade as long as you have at least one puppet string attached to a creature. You treat the value of the weakness to mental damage from Puppet String as the damage value of Arcane Cascade for the purposes of feats and abilities dependent on Arcane Cascades damage bonus. Hybrid studies or feats that increase the damage bonus of the Arcane Cascade stance (such as laughing shadow), instead increase the weakness to mental damage by the same amount.

If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.nlXyh7828TgZIewv]{Capture Magic}, you can create a puppet string to the foe who targeted you when you used your reaction, so long as the foe is within 30 feet of you. If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.mB7ENhF10qoOwQyG]{Resounding Cascade}, allies within the emanation also have puppet strings attached to the triggering foe and can benefit from its effects with the same restrictions as normal (such as not gaining increased weaknesses from the laughing shadow hybrid study).

Slidecasting.name: Slidecasting
Slidecasting.description:
Grants

  • @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.eMVMmc60XP9LCc6s]{Effect: Arcane Cascade: Slidecast}
  • But you can use this macro to auto-set the duration:@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-macros.Macro.rDL8c8yOxZLLEyro]{Add Slidecast with Correct Duration}

Somatic components are part of what makes spells whole, and youâ€™ve learned how to combine these movements with your steps. You slide around the battlefield with sprays of sparks and spell residue, making you a highly mobile combatant.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-actions.Item.mU9DEfQL99lY8CC2]{Slidecast} reaction. Whenever you Step or Stride in the same turn you also Cast a Spell or Spellstrike, you gain a +1 status bonus to your Reflex saves against effects that target an area for 2 rounds. This bonus lasts for 3 rounds if you have weapon specialization, or 4 rounds if you have greater weapon specialization.

You are considered to be in Arcane Cascade as long as you are benefiting from this bonus for the purposes of feats and abilities that rely on you being in Arcane Cascade. For determining values that would be dependent on the Arcane Cascade stanceâ€™s damage bonus, you instead use the starting number of rounds you are affected by this bonus as the damage amount. Hybrid studies or feats that increase the damage bonus of the Arcane Cascade stance instead grant you a damage bonus equal to the increased amount that lasts for the same duration and follows the same rules for damage types as the Arcane Cascade stance.

If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.nlXyh7828TgZIewv]{Capture Magic}, you can Step as part of that reaction. If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.mB7ENhF10qoOwQyG]{Resounding Cascade}, allies within the emanation can Step and gain the status bonus to Reflex saves as long as they remain in the emanation and you are benefiting from your Arcane Cascade.

Soul Essence - Trade.name: Soul Essence - Trade
Soul Essence - Trade.description:
Trade Your hold on life is weak and your havok causes you to waste away. You take a â€“2 penalty to Fortitude saves against death effects and gain a weakness to negative damage, or positive damage if you have negative healing, equal to half your level (minimum 1).

Traded Havok After you use an action with the Havok trait, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increase your drained value by 1 if you were already drained. Unlike the normal requirements for the drained condition, you can reduce the drained condition caused by an action with the havok trait by 1 if you make a successful Strike or spend 10 minutes attuning your essences.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.OMqrz2X3ejGwG2rE]{Effect: Soul Essence - Traded Havok}

Thousand-Touch Arcana.name: Thousand-Touch Arcana
Thousand-Touch Arcana.description:
You are a student of thousand-touch arcana, an inter- planar martial art that blends the casting of spells with measured breathing and swift punches and kicks. When battle starts, you become a force to be reckoned with indeed.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.L5nSP8CkHWSLp2vV]{Arcane Fists} magus feat as a bonus feat.

While in @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-class-features.Item.SkUkDSnIU1LHBSHf]{Arcane Cascade+}, if you make a successful unarmed Strike against a target you can also ignore an amount of resistance equal to half your level of a resistance type that matches your Arcane Cascade damage type. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

Unlimited Signature Spells.name: Unlimited Signature Spells
Unlimited Signature Spells.description: All of your spells are signature spells. That means that if you know a spell, you can heighten it freely by casting it from a higher-level spell slot, up to the maximum level of spell you can cast. You can similarly cast any of its lower-level versions without learning them separately.
